contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=December 2009}} {{infobox IPA |ipa number=132 401 |ipa symbol=sʼ |imagefile=IPA alveolar ejective fricative.png |decimal1=115|decimal2=700| |x-sampa=s_>|kirshenbaum=s`}} The '''alveolar ejective fricative''' is a type of [[consonant]]al sound, used in some spoken [[language]]s. The symbol in the [[International Phonetic Alphabet]] that represents this sound is ⟨{{IPA|sʼ}}⟩. ==Features== Features of the alveolar ejective fricative: {{sibilant}} {{alveolar}} {{voiceless short}} {{oral}} {{central articulation}} {{ejective}} ==Occurrence== {| class="wikitable" ! colspan="2"|Language !! Word !! [[International Phonetic Alphabet|IPA]]!! Meaning !! Notes |- | [[Adyghe language|Adyghe]] || Shapsug dialect|| {{lang|kbd-Cyrl|[[Cyrillic script|шӀу'''сӀ'''э]]}} || {{Audio|Shosaa.ogg|[ʃʷʼəsʼa]}} || 'black' || Corresponds to {{IPA|[tsʼ]}} in other dialects. |- | colspan="2" | [[Hausa language|Hausa]] || {{example needed|date=January 2010}}|| || || Allophone of {{IPA|/tsʼ/}} in some dialects |- | colspan="2" | [[Lakota language|Lakota]] || {{example needed|date=January 2010}}|| || || |- | colspan="2" | [[Tlingit language|Tlingit]] || [[Tlingit alphabet|'''''sʼ'''aaw'']] || {{IPA|[sʼaːw]}} || '[[Dungeness crab]]' || |- | colspan="2" | [[Upper Necaxa Totonac]] || colspan="2" align="center" | {{IPA|[ˈsʼa̰ta̰]}} || small' || |} ==See also== * [[List of phonetic topics]] {{IPA navigation}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Alveolar Ejective Fricative}} [[Category:Alveolar consonants]] [[Category:Fricative consonants]] [[Category:Ejectives]]
